turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 1997–98 South Pacific cyclone season.
turn.1: What happened during the 1997–98 South Pacific cyclone season?
turn.2: Early on April 25, Alan passed near too or over the French Polynesian Society Islands of Maupiti, Bora-Bora, and Raiatea.
turn.3: Was there a lot of damage?
turn.4: During April 25, strong wind shear pulled the system apart, with visible imagery showing that the system had a fully exposed low level circulation.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: As a result, the FMS reported that the system had weakened into a depression at 1800 UTC that day, while it was located about to the west-northwest of Tahiti.
turn.7: Did a lot of people die?
turn.8: The NPMOC subsequently reissued their final advisory early the next day, as the system drifted towards the south-southeast while located to the west of Tahiti.
turn.10: The system affected French Polynesia with high winds and torrential rain, which caused several landslides within the Society Islands.
turn.11: What other damage did it do?
turn.12: The landslides caused two bridges to collapse and along with fallen trees blocked roads.
